title: Spinach & Feta Borek
description: Crispy baked borek filled with tender sautéed spinach, tangy feta and aromatic herbs, wrapped in flaky phyllo. A savory Mediterranean pastry perfect for brunch, lunch or a shareable appetizer.

ingredients.display_name: fresh spinach, washed and coarsely chopped

ingredients.notes: about 30 g per sheet, thawed if frozen and kept covered with a damp towel
use a tangy sheep/goat blend if possible
one for filling binder, one for egg wash
zest of one lemon for brightness
adjust to taste; includes salt on feta

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 190°C (375°F). Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking pan or line with parchment and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the diced onion and sauté until translucent and soft.
Add minced garlic to the skillet and cook, stirring, until fragrant but not browned.
Add the chopped spinach in batches to the skillet, steaming and stirring until wilted and most moisture has evaporated. Season with half the salt and pepper.
Transfer wilted spinach to a colander or bowl and press or squeeze gently to remove excess liquid. Return to a bowl to cool slightly.

In a mixing bowl, combine cooled spinach, crumbled feta, chopped parsley, chopped dill (if using), lemon zest (if using), one beaten egg, remaining salt, pepper and a pinch of nutmeg. Mix until evenly combined.

Lay one sheet of phyllo on a clean work surface and brush lightly with melted butter. Layer a second sheet on top and brush. Trim phyllo to fit the pan if needed. Repeat to create layered sheets for base.
Press a layered stack of phyllo sheets into the prepared pan to form the base, brushing between layers. Spread the spinach–feta filling evenly over the base.

Create the top by layering remaining phyllo sheets, brushing each with butter. Cover filling completely and tuck edges to seal. Brush the top sheet thoroughly with the remaining melted butter and beat the second egg to brush over the surface for a golden finish.
Using a sharp knife, score the top layers into serving portions to make cutting easier after baking. Bake in preheated oven until phyllo is deep golden brown and crisp.
Remove from oven and let cool in the pan for about 5–8 minutes to set. Cut fully along the scored lines and serve warm or at room temperature.
